page.title: 12SCARVA'S IRISH SODA FARLS
page.content: Soda bread is baked on a griddle. A griddle is a flat round piece of metal with a handle attached to it. Its diameter is about 40 cm it is placed on the top of the cooker while the bread is being baked. Soda bread is tasty fried, or toasted or it's delicious simply with butter spread on it. INGREDIENTS.....340g of soda bread flour....225ml of buttermilk. Heat the griddle until the flour sprinkled on it quickly turns brown. Mix the buttermilk into the flour with a spoon. Turn all out on to a well floured bread board. Sprinkle with flour. Roll lightly until it is 1.5 cm thick, divide into four sections with a knife. Place immediately on the heated griddle.Turn when baked one side. Place on a cooling tray when baked.
